column3: NACK -- I'll soften my position on non-standard transactions when there is a good fast-initial-download solution implemented and the transaction fee code is reworked.\n
Non-standard transactions were disabled for a reason, and nothing has reasonably changed since then...why enable them or make it easy to do so?\n
NAK'd, closing.  People who really need this can modify the source.\n

Considering that merging this would have avoided [the recent sigop-flooding problem](https://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/3pouij/new_cheap_way_to_flood_attack_bitcoin_network/), can I get this reopened and reconsidered? (note it must be reopened before I can rebase/push the latest branch and get it updated)\n
@luke-jr how would it have avoided that?\n

[The top commit since early 2014](https://github.com/luke-jr/bitcoin/commit/a524f5449ecffebfeae7df3da36c109357fc2e1e) limits sigops to a reasonable rate per bytes. This not only causes the fee logic to reflect the cost as expected, but also requires any attempt to spam sigops to also spam data meeting the block size before the block sigop limit.\n
Fair enough,  but,  that isn't part of this PR?\n
It is as soon as it gets reopened. (GitHub ignores updates when the PR is closed.)\n

Any update on this, @luke-jr? Identical attack resurfaced 3 days ago:

> https://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/3ur5ma/stuck_transactions/
it seems transaction is usually "tx" rather than "txn", isn't it?\n
